Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is spotted with traces of a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.171) (?)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36380) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36380)
